text: The Prime Minister of Malta () is the Head of Government, which is the highest official of Malta. The office of "Head of Ministry" was created as soon as Malta was granted autonomous government in 1921. ==Appointment== The President of Malta, who heads the Executive branch, appoints the Prime Minister. The Prime Minister advises the President on the appointment of the other Ministers. ==Role== As minister in his own right the Prime Minister is responsible for a number of departments of government. The Office of the Prime Minister (OPM) has been based at the Auberge de Castille in Valletta since 1972, playing a central role in decision-making apart from being the administrative headquarters of the Government. ==Living former prime ministers== Name Term Date of birth Karmenu Mifsud Bonnici 1984–1987 Eddie Fenech Adami 1987–1996 1998–2004 Alfred Sant 1996–1998 Lawrence Gonzi 2004–2013 Joseph Muscat 2013–2020 ==References== * Category:Government of Malta
title: Prime Minister of Malta
